name: Sony Ericsson HID Keypad Configuration
summary: Learn about .KCF files and view a list of programs that open them.

content: You can pair a Bluetooth-enabled Sony Ericsson cell phone with your computer to use the phone as a computer remote control. Each phone includes a default remote configuration, which maps the phone's buttons to computer functions. However, you can customize this configuration using Sony Ericsson Bluetooth Remote Control software.

After creating a custom configuration in Sony Ericsson Bluetooth Remote Control Software, you can save the configuration as an HID file and send it to your phone. Each HID file is a .TAR archive that includes a KCF file and a .JPG file. The KCF file contains XML data that specifies your custom button mapping.

instructions: Because KCF files are XML files, you can open and edit them in any text or source code editor, such as Microsoft Visual Studio Code or GitHub Atom.

To send a KCF file to your Sony Ericsson phone, you must package the file in an HID file. Then, after pairing your phone with your computer, you can send the HID file to your phone using the Bluetooth File Exchange utility in macOS or the Bluetooth Devices Control Panel in Windows.

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download
